name: Victoria Ashford
title: Lady Victoria of Celestia
core_wound: Constantly overlooked and underestimated because she's the daughter, not the son; smarter and more capable than her brother but will never inherit; forced to watch less qualified men make decisions
wants: To prove she's worthy of power and change the inheritance laws to allow daughters to rule
needs: To find value in herself beyond titles and power; to fight for others, not just her own advancement
voice_markers: Precise and cutting wit - uses intelligence as weapon
Asks seemingly innocent questions that expose contradictions
References classical literature and philosophy frequently
Maintains perfect composure even when seething inside
Says 'how fascinating' in deadly dry tone when she thinks something is stupid
contradiction: Fights against the aristocratic system while wanting to lead it; claims she wants equality but also wants power; generous to those beneath her while ruthless to peers
physical_description: Elegant and beautiful with her mother's auburn hair and father's blue eyes. Always impeccably dressed in sophisticated gowns that are subtly more modern and daring than expected. Carries herself with quiet confidence that makes people listen when she speaks.

relationships.Lysander_Ashford: Father; he barely sees her as a person, just a marriageable asset; she resents him deeply but hides it perfectly
relationships.Cassandra_Ashford: Mother; close relationship; Victoria is learning about her mother's secret reformist activities and beginning to join her
relationships.Marcus_Ashford: Brother; loves him but frustrated that he gets everything handed to him; protective of him despite resentment
relationships.Elena_Navarro: Mother's friend; becoming Victoria's political mentor; teaching her about reform movements
relationships.Adrian_Sterling: Charming rake from merchant family; pursuing her romantically; she's attracted but suspects ulterior motives
relationships.Zara_Volkov: Enemy family's daughter; secret correspondence has developed into unlikely friendship; both rebels in their own way

secrets: Secretly studying political theory and law to prepare for leadership she'll never be allowed to have
Has been communicating with Zara Volkov through encrypted channels - would be seen as treason
Knows about her mother's reformist activities and is helping
Being courted by Adrian Sterling but suspects he's after the Ashford connection, not her
Has discovered evidence of her father's illegitimate daughter and is investigating
knowledge_state: Highly educated in politics, economics, law, and philosophy
Understands social reform movements better than most of her family
Knows about various family secrets through careful observation
Aware of the Ashford-Volkov vendetta's true origins
Does not know her mother is negotiating with Dmitri Volkov
Does not yet know she's being set up for arranged marriage to Nikolai Volkov
